Ah ?if þu wult me lenen & þine læue iunnen. and þu me wulle fulsten and ferde bi-tæchen. and swa muchel of þine garsume. god swa þe þunche ich wulle uorð aneouste and faren ouer Humbre. & Oswy þer makien ærmest alre kingen. no scal he mid strenðe þene stude uinde. þat ich hine nulle þe an hond sulle. oðer quic oðer ded þat me þuncheð god ræd & ?if þu þis nult don þu scalt wurse under-fon. for Oswy is a swulc mon þine scome he wulle don. Þa andswarede Cadwalan þe kene. Penda ich hit þe sugge ouer-al Oswy haueð for-wal oðer he lið ibedde ibunden mid ufele. oðer uncuðe leoden icumen beoð to his þeoden. for nulle he nauere icnawen þat he nolde him to cumen. þa ich hehte alle cumen mid griðe mid friðe. and mid lufe. Ah Penda ga þider ut anan ich wulle wið mine eorlen mine rune halden. and minne red finden wheðer ich þe ?etten wullen. þa þing þe þu bede. and ich wulle after Oswine senden aðele mine sonde. and haten hine hi?indliche cumen to mine riche. Þider ut eode Pe[n]da an eorl wes his iuere. and Cadwaðlan wes þer-inne mid swiðe feole monne. Þus him spac Cadwaðlan þe king wes of Englen. ?e beoð mine men alle þa beoð a þisse mote. and ?e habbeoð alle iherd whæt Penda king hafueð iseid. and hu he wulle taken on & Oswi king al fordon. ?if ic him lenen wulle mine leoden to vulste. and ic wulle þat ?e me reden of wlchere deden. þa ich lete Oswi for-do þa ich lete hine cumen me to. & ?if he for mire sonde for-sakeð hider to cumene. mine here ich lete seoððen hine hene makien. Þa iwærð abol?en a Welisc king in þe hepen. he wes ihaten Margadud monnen wurðe him ?eomerist for æuere he Ænglisce men bi-hehte hærm þene meste. Þus seide Mærgadud of Suð Wales he wes duc. Her nu me Cadwaðlan whæt ich þe wulle cuðe. Þu hauest þine willen iseid ah þis nis noht god red. Hit is swiðe ?are þat Bruttes comen here. and mid him ure ældre þe Bruttes weoren aðele. and þis lond ieoden Bruttisce leoden. and longe hit walden after heore willen. þa while þa hit wes on heore hond hit wes ihaten Brut-lond. Nu nabbe we of þan londe buten þene west ende. þa Bruttes hafden iwuned here wel feole wintre. Þa comen Englisce men mid heore ufele craften. heo weore wi?el-fulle and þis lond al biwunne. and biswiken heore lauerd sonen and alle his leoden. & ?iuenen heore kinge ane heðene quene. þa comen of Sex-londe þa leoden us beoð laðe. þurh þere quene ure cun aqualden here. and swa habbeoð Englisce men ure icunden at-heolden. þet we nauere seoððen bi-sechen hit no mihten. Penda king is Englisc and Oswy al-swa ful iwis. Let þu þa hundes hannen to-gaderes. eiðer freten oðer swa hund deð his broðer. and leten heore whelpes whæruen heom bi-sides. elc oðer quelle þat þer nan quic no leue. And ?if Oswy cumeð bufen and þat feht ma?en ouer-cumen. we him sculleð to luken and neouðer hine aleggen. lond and his leoden and his la?en uallen. and ?if Penda bið buuen & þat comp ma?en ouer-cumen. þin a?e mon is Penda mid alle his kine-londa. Þenne hauest þu Englisc lond to þire a?ere hond. and alle þine wurðscipe þus þu miht biwinnen. & libben a þin lif swa þe arle leofest bið. No findest þu nauer-mare mon þa þe durre haten on. Þa andswarede a mon þe bald wes on hireden. Lust nu me Cadwaðlan lust me ane stunden. Nis þar nan betere red þene Margadud haueð ised. & ?if þat nult don þu scalt wurse afon. & alle þine leoden þa later þu hafuest to neoden. Efne þissere sa?e þa þe Brut sæide. þa wes icleoped Penda & com into hirede. and Cadwaðlan him ?ette al þat he wolde. Þa wes Penda bliðe & igladed swiðe. Penda & his cnihtes to horsen forð-rihtes. and aneousten gunnen wenden toward Norh-humberlonden. & Oswi iherden suggen þat Penda hine sohte. & ?arecode his ferden & fusde to?æines Pendan. faht heo bigunnen ræ?e heo weoren beien. feondliche heo fuhten uæiden heo weoren. vnimete feollen fæie men on folden. Þa hit wes uppen non þa sunne gon to nipen. þer wes Oswy of-sla?en & idon of lif-da?en. & his sune & his æm & eorles sume uiuen. þer weoren ni?e þusu[n]de ðringes norðerne. isla?en i þan dæi?e þa du?eðe wes þa lasse. & þe king Penda sære wes iwunded þa. & þonene gon wende æst to his londe. Oswy hæfden ænne sune Osric wes his nome. he wes ane stunde mid Cadwaðlane kinge. in his h[i]rede iued & deorliche ifostred. Osric bisohte Cadwalan swa mon scal his lauerde don. þat he moste beon his mon & his fader lond habbeon. Cadwaðlan him ?et al þat he ?irde. he bitahte him an hond al his fader kine-lond. hehte hine hit habben & halde mid wunne. God king wes Cadwaðlan swa him wes icunden. he wes king hire seouen and feouwerti ?ere. Þa uerde he to Lunden to gladien þa leoden. and heold ane metsunge mid þan uolke of Lundene. he æt of ane uisce uret-liche swiðe. ær þe uisc i-eten weore. i-uueled was þe ki[n]g. seouen niht & enne dæi þe king a þan ufele læi. nes þer nan oðer red seoððen wes þe king ded. heo bureden hine in Lunden særi weoren þa leoden. Enne sune hafde Cadwaðlan Cadwalader ihaten. he wes Penda suster sune al of kingen icume. þeos feng to his riche after his fader dai?e. Swiðe leoflic wes þe mon his leoden hine luueden. he wes swiðe god cniht and swiðe sturne inne fiht. æh an his da?en ilompen reoðen on leoden. Ærst aswond þat corn here ?eond al þas kineriche. þer-after hit wes swa deore & al folc gon to de?en. swa þat þu mihtes fare fulle seouen nihte. þat no mihtest þu. þurh nene chep finde neouwer na bred. an bur?e and on londe leoden weoren ?eoumere. no nan uolc on londe þat of-fingred nes sære. Þa þat wes idriuuen longe ?eond þas leoden. þa com þer an-oðer sor?e þer-after ful sone. þat quale com on orue vnimete swiðe. þer cheorl draf his sul?e i-oxned swiðe fæire. oðer while he brohte ham halue his oxen. oðer brohte enne þe oðer no brohte nenne. and swa hit on leode ilaste wel longe. Þer-after sone sor?en vnimete. comen to folke ?eond al þas kine-þeode. uppen þan monen morð wes iwurðen. quelen þa eorles quelen þa beornes. quelen þa þeines quelen þa sweines. quelen þa lareden quelen þa leouweden. quelan þa ældren quelen þa ?eongeren. quelæn þa wifmen quelen þa wanclen. þat no mihte on þan ende þat folc on þan londe. burien þa dede swiðe heo gunnen de?e. þat ofte in þan putte þer me þene dede isette. þer dei?ede þe quike uppen þen dede. And swa hit ilomp wide ?eond Ænglene þeode. þat folc ut of londe flah on ælche ænde. monie hundred tunen bi-læued weoren of monnen. þat lut me uinde mihte men uaren ?eond londe. Wa wæs Cadwalader þe king wes on londe. for scome he ne mihte fleon no for hærme her beon. Neoðeles he hine biþohte hu he faren mahte. he nom his maðmes alle and his m[e]n deore. & bah suð ouer sæ. into Brutaine. and nom þe[r] wickinge mid Alaine þan kinge. þe wæs sune Salemonnes. þas sele kinges. þe swiðe lufede Cadwaðlan þe while his dai?es ilaste. Þær Alæin þe king Cadwalader under-ueng. & funde him in þan londe al þat he wolde. þurh elleouen ?ere þe king wunede þere. & elleouen ?ere þe sorh?e wunede here. þat wes hunger & hette nefede þat folc nenne mete. & þe qualm muchele þe wes on moncunne. Þat folc flah in-to wuden & wuneden in þe cluden. leien in þa stan-graffen & liueden bi deoren. heo l[i]ueden bi wuden heo l[i]feden bi wurten. bi moren and bi rote nas þer nan oðer boten. Þa elleue ?er weoren on fast a?eongen þa sunne gon to scine þe rein bi-gon to rine. þe qualm gon to stunte men gunnen to sturien. ut of wude heo dro?en and wuneden in tunen. Heo speken to-somne & spileden bi-tweonen. and nomen heore sonde and sende in-to Sex-londe. and cudden heore cunne of heore quale-siðe. & hu heo ifaren hafden elleue ?eren. & hu þat ufel wes at-stunt & hu þa tunes ibuld. and hu þer wes fæi?er lond i-noh seoluer and gold. & beden heom cumen swiðe hider to heore icunde. for þa Bruttes þa ær weoren here æuere heo weren fleme. no durste heo næuere mængen imong Englisce monnen. no nawhit heo nusten of heore uare-costen þat weoren heore sonden. isend to Sex-londen. Þa he?e Sexisce men iherden þas sonden. þa fusden touward sæ fifti þusende. baldere beornen mid scelden and mid burnen. mid wifen and mid children to þissen londe wenden. Mid þan formeste swipen her comen þreo hundred scipen si?en after seoððe sixti to-somne. bi sixe bi seouene bi tene bi eolleue. bi twelue bi twenti bi þritti bi feowerti. Mid heom com Æðelstan þe æ[ð]ele ut of Sexen. inne Lundene hine cruneden & houen hine to kingen. Edward þe king þesne bi?at on are chiuese. þis wes þe formeste Englisce mon þe al Ængle-lond biwon. he wes icruned and ieled. þis lond wes al his a?en. and seoððen he wuneden here sixtene ?ere. Hit ilomp inne frimdæ?en feor her bi-æften. þat her wes an heh mon Inne wes ihaten. Þe king wende to Rome to þan he?e dome. and he Peteres weofed þere wunliche isohte. brohte þer to lake his maðmes leofe. Þa ?et he dude mare to Peteres are. of æuer-elche huse þat hus-bonde wunede. & his biweddede wif weore on þere ilke wike. þe king enne peni ?ette to Peteres huse. Inne wes þe uormeste mon þe Peteres peni bigon. Þa Inne king wes him ded. and his la?en weoren aleid. þa a-feol þat feoh here fif and sixti ?ere. a þet Aðelstan com liðen in-to þissen londen. & hafden iwuned here fulle fiftene ?ere. Þe king his fet custe and faire hine igrette. & eft þat ilke feoh ?ete. þat Inne king dude ære. & swa hit hafeð ist onde æuer seoððe a þisse londe. Drihten wat hu longe þeo la?en scullen ilæste. þa tiden comen sone to Cadwaðlader kinge. into Brutaine þer þar he wunede. mid Alaine kinge þe wes of his cunne. me dude him to under-stonde of al þisse londe. hu Aðelstan her com liðen ut of Sex-londen. and hu he al Angle-lond sette on his a?ere hond. and hu he sette moting & hu he sette husting. and hu he sette sciren and makede frið of deoren. & hu he sette halimot & hu he sette hundred. and þa nomen of þan tunen on Sexisce runen. & ?ilden he gon rere mucle & swiðe mære. & þa chirchen he gon dihten after Sexisce irihten. and Sexis he gan kennen þa nomen of þan monnen. and al me him talde þe tiden of þisse londe. Wa wes Cadwaledere þat he wes on liue. leofere him weore on deðe þeone quic on life. særi wes his heorte and sorhful wes his du?ede. Wið his freond he spac ofte hu he faren mihte. and iw[i]nnen his rihte. and wulchere wise he mihte wið Aðelstane fihte. & i-winnen his cunde æft to his honde. þa Aðestan and his cnihtes eke heolde mid unrihte. Sume him radde to uehten summe wrið to wurchen. þat he mosten of Aðelstan. halden his lond and beon his mon. Vnder þissen uare-coste he sumnede ferde. of alle þane monne þat he bi-?eten mihte. & somnede alle þa scipen þa bi þare sæ fluten. and þohte mid strengðe steppen to londe. Þa þe ?aru wes þa uerde & þas scipen ibone. com þe win[d] suðerne. þa sæt an heore wille. Þa sæide þe king Nu to scipe an hi?ing. And þe king in-to chirche gon wenden Godes werk to worchen. and masse þer iherden of mære ane preoste. Þe king læi on cneouwen and cleopede to Crist[e]. & bed ure Drihten þe walt alle deden. þat he from him-selue taken him sende. ?if hit weore iqueme þan heouenliche Deme. wheðer he scolde liðen þe he scolde bi-lauen. Þe while þe he spac touward Goden þa gon he to slepen. þa gon he to slumme selehðe him wes ?iueðe of seoluen ure Drihten þe scop þis dæ?es lihte. Þenne þe king imætte. a cneouwen he slepte. þat him com bi-foren gon a wunder ane fair mon. & þas word kende to Bruttene kinge. A-wake Cadwalader Crist þe haueð deore. and ?arke þine uore and far swi[ð]e to Rome. þu uindest ænne pape preost mid þan bezste. he þe scal scriuen of þine weorld-lifen. þat þine sunen alle scullen þe from falle. and þu scalt wurðe clene al þurh Godes dome. of alle þine misdede þurh mihte of ure Drihte. And seo[ð]ðen þu scalt i-witen and faren to heofne-richen. for no most þu nauere-mære Ængle-lond a?e. ah Alemainisce men Ænglen scullen a?en. and næuermære Bruttisce men bruken hit ne moten. ær cume þe time þe iqueðen wes while. þat Merlin þe wite?e bodede mid worde. Þenne sculle Bruttes sone bu?en to Rome and dra?en ut þine banes alle of þene marme-stane. and mid blissen heom uerien uorð mid heom-seoluen. in seoluere and in golde in-to Brutlonde. Þenne sculle Bruttes anan balde iwurðen. al þat heo bi-ginneð to done iwurðeð after heore wille. þenne scullen i Bruttene blissen wurðen riue. wastmes and wederes sele after heore i-wille. Þa awoc Cadwalader wu[n]der him þuhte. strongliche he wes auæred ladliche of-furhte. to wulche þinge hit iteon wolde þat him wes itacned þere Ofte he lette runen ofte he lette ræde. and seowede hit þan kinge þe wunede in þan londe. þe inemned wes Alain Cadwalader nexte mæi. Þe king sende his sonde ?eond al his londe. and lette beoden alle. þa bocares wise. and talden heom þa tacni[n]ge of Cadwalader kinge. Þær heo gunnen ræde þer heo gunnen rune. & radden him to taken on al swa Godd him hafde itakned to don. Þer he bi-lafde his scipen and his leode. his wæi and his iwille He cleopede heom to stille. Yuni and Iuore bei?en heo weoren him deore. Yuor wes his step-sune and Yuni his suster sune. beien heo weoren him leofe beine heo weoren him deore. heo weoren cnihtes beien and swiðe wel idihte. Þus spac Cadwalader þe king wes of Bruttene. Yuor and Yuni beiene ?et senden of mine leode. hercnieð mine lare. no scal hit eou reouwe nauere Of heouene me beoð icume hi?e Godes tacne. þat ich scal faren to Rome to þan pape wel idone. Þe pape hatte Sergius he weteð Peteres. hus. me and mine wiue he scal bletsei?en & scriue. & þer we scullen ure da?es ba driuen to þan ende. longe bið auer no iseo ?e me æft næuere. Ah here ich bi-tache inc Walisc lond þat ?et stond a mire hond. and nimeð þas muchele uerde and fareð to þan londe. and haldeð hit on wunne þa wile ?e ma?en hit werie. and ich inc halsi beien þurh þan heouen kinge. þat unker æiðer oðer luuie swa his broðer. and habbeoð þat lond auer-mære. tou æure liues ende. & brukeð hit on wunne & eouwer bernen alle. Yuni hit wes itacned me alse ?e scullen nu i-seo. for Merlin þe wise hit seide mid worde al of mine for[ð]-fare & of mire unimete care. and Sibillie þa wise a bocken hit isette. þat ich scal iuullen mines Drihtes wille. Alc faren nu his wæi and habbeoð alle godne dæi. Cadwalader fusde þat he com to Rome. þer he Sergius funde þene iselie pape. he scraf Cadwalader þe king wes of Bruttenne. Ne wunede þe king þer bute uifte half ?ere. þa com him ufel on swa Godd hit wolde habben idon. elleoue da?es biforen Mai?e he ferde of þisse liue. and his saule sende to þan heouen-licche kinge. His ban beoð iloken faste i guldene cheste. and þer heo scullen wunie þat þa da?es beon icumene. þa Merlin ine iuurn da?en vastnede mid worden. Ga we nu to Yuni a-?an & to Iuore his wedde-broðere. Heo somneden ferde wide ?eond þan ærde. forð heo gunnen fusen mid fif hundred scipenen. nes hit nawit longe þat heo ne comen to Walisce londe. Al þas Bruttes weoren to-driuen ?eond cludes & ?eond cliuenen. ?eond chirchen & ?eond muneccliuen. ?eond wudes & ?eond liðen Sone me heom saiden. þat isi?en weoren to londe. mid Iuore & Yuni ten siðen fifti. scipen brade-fulle of Brutten swiðe balde. Þæs Bruttes on ælc ende foren to Walisce londe. and heore la?en leofeden & heore leodene þæuwen. and ?et wunie[ð] þære swa heo doð auere-mære. & Ænglisce kinges walden þas londes. & Bruttes hit loseden þis lond and þas leoden þat næuere seoððen mære kinges neoren here. Þa ?et ne com þæs ilke dæi beo heonne-uorð alse hit mæi. i-wurðe þet iwurðe i-wurðe Godes wille. Amen.
